description: Erection of a pair of two storey two bedroom semi-detached houses with associated amenity space and cycle/ waste storage.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (967/RDP/P01 (Rev D); 967/RDP/P02 (Rev C); 967/RDP/P03 (Rev D) Received: 23 February 2021; 967/RDP/P04 (Rev A) Received: 10 February 2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Materials
The pair of semi-detached houses hereby approved shall be constructed fully in accordance with the Materials Schedule hereby approved.

Condition : 4 - Landscaping
No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, which shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include hard surfacing materials, sustainable drainage features, minor artefacts and structures (including furniture, play equipment, storage units and lighting), proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (including drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports, etc), details of all boundary treatments within the site and soft landscaping (including a planting schedule noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate, and an Implementation Plan.  The proposed soft landscaping design shall include appropriately positioned new trees and shrubs inside the boundaries of each side garden and within each front garden.  

All planting comprised in the approved details shall be carried out during the first planting and seeding season following completion of the construction works and the hard surfaces, site boundary treatments and other elements shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.  Any trees or shrubs planted (including any such replacements) which die within five years from the date of planting shall be replaced in the next planting season with the same species of comparable maturity.

Condition : 5 - Waste Storage and Restrictions
Prior to the first occupation of the development, details of waste/ recycling storage units designed in accordance with Council's Recycling and Refuse Guidance:  Guide for Architects and Planners shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority, implemented and permanently retained as such.   

Waste/ recycling bins shall be placed for collection within the front gardens of each house only.  No waste, recyclable materials or bins related to either house hereby approved shall be placed on the public highway at any time.

Condition : 6 - Cycle Parking
Prior to the first occupation of the development, details of proposed cycle storage units to provide two single level lockable, covered and enclosed cycle parking spaces using a Sheffield stand format for each house, designed in accordance with the WestTRANS Cycle Design Guidance, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved storage units shall be implemented and permanently retained as approved.

Condition : 7 - Removal of Vehicle Crossover
The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the site's existing vehicular crossover from Queens Road has been permanently closed, and the footway and full-height kerb reinstated with a Controlled Parking Zone bay extended along the closed access to ensure that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.  

Note:  These works can only be carried out by an approved Council contractor and you should contact Hounslow Highways to arrange for the work to be carried out.

Condition : 8 - Controlled Parking Zone Restrictions
Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to Section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit.  Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.

Condition : 9 - Energy Sustainability
i.	The development shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted Energy Strategy hereby approved and prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates) under the Standard Assessment Procedure should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the Energy Strategy hereby approved, and any subsequent approved revisions.  

ii.	Upon final commencement of operation of low and zero carbon technologies hereby approved, suitable devices for their monitoring shall have been installed and monitoring data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 10 - Water Sustainability
Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures' literature) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.

Condition : 11 - Sustainable Construction
The development hereby approved is required to meet the following sustainable materials standards and shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs of materials in-situ and/or copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the implementation of the development complied with the following:

i.	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) achieved a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide specification.  
ii.	At least 50% of timber and timber products were sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.  
iii.	No construction or insulation materials were used which release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 12 - Rear Window Restrictions
All first floor rear windows and the ground floor bathroom windows of the development hereby approved shall be obscure glazed, non-openable below 1.75 metres above finished floor level and be permanently retained as such.

Condition : 13 - Front House Name Plaques
The name plaque for each house shall clearly identify the address of each property and be incorporated into the fabric of each house in the materials and style shown in the approved drawings, and these shall be permanently retained.  

Note:  The content of the plaque must conform to address details that shall have been first agreed with the Council's Naming/Numbering Service.

Condition : 14 - Hours of Construction and Construction Management
No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  

No materials or other construction deliveries or collections shall take place at the site outside of these hours.  

Any vehicles that are used on site as part of the construction shall have their wheels cleaned of all mud before they leave the site and the resulting debris and run-off shall not be discharged on to the adjoining footway or carriageway.  

The developer shall monitor the condition of the adjoining highway before and after each delivery and/or collection and the carriageway shall be cleaned immediately if any vehicle involved in these activities sheds mud on to the public highway or pavement, removing all such debris to a collection point within the development site.  

No work shall start on site before details have been submitted to the local planning authority to show the condition of the carriageway and footway between Lampton Road and the eastern boundary of the site and measures have been put in place in to protect the adjoining carriageway and footway from damage at all times.  These shall be retained for the duration of the construction and landscaping phases of the development.  

No site lighting shall be used that sheds light beyond the boundaries of the site, and measures shall be put in place to suppress dust generation during dry weather.

Note:  You will need to consult with the Local Highway Authority about any necessary highway protection and restoration measures in order to comply with this condition.

Condition : 16 - Restriction of Permitted Development Rights
Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1 Classes A to F and Part 2 Class B of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order replacing, revoking or re-enacting that Order) no enlargement or alterations to the buildings, or erection of additional structures/buildings within the boundaries of the site, shall be implemented, and no vehicular access shall be formed to the premises.
